0.sentence: There isn't much features on the iPod at all, except games.

1.sentence: SOUND QUALITY: The iPod's sound quality is pretty good.

2.sentence: It has an equalizer, but the iRiver H10-20GB has a lot more presets than the iPod.

3.sentence: The bass is deep and the treble is clear.

4.sentence: The bass is deep and the treble is clear.

5.sentence: DURABILITY: Not good. First problem, if you haven't seen the news recently, the iPods are being recalled for battery problems and not lasting the advertised 18 months.

6.sentence: Also, the battery's AREN'T USER REPLACEABLE.

7.sentence: Another thing you should know, the metal on the flip side of the iPod is very tacky, and scratches very easily.

8.sentence: Also, not liking the gel case.

9.sentence: FEATURES: Really, there aren't any features, unless you call the games a feature.

10.sentence: There is no FM tuner, while there is no FM tuner on the Creative Zen (on the micro version of the Zen there is a tuner), the iRiver H10-20GB, the Rio Karma, and the iAudio X5 have FM tuners.

11.sentence: There is also no voice recording, something most if not all MP3 players have that the iPod doesn't.

12.sentence: There is no photo viewing option, however, there is a 20 GB photo iPod, but it costs $20 more.

13.sentence: EASE OF USE/DESIGN: The iPod is a very easy to use MP3 player, and if you can't figure this out, you shouldn't even own one.

14.sentence: I'm probably the only person that dislikes the iTunes software.

15.sentence: CUSTOMER SERVICE: Awful. Listen to this one, remember the battery statement I made earlier.

16.sentence: There technical service isn't helpful either; they just read what's on their website and charge you $50 (+ toll fees) to do it.

17.sentence: OVERALL: I highly dislike the iPod, even though the sound quality and design is above-average.

27.sentence: The software with the iPod includes iTunes, which allows you to play the music on your computer, rip CDs onto your computer, and move your music from the computer to the iPod.

28.sentence: This new click wheel iPod allows you to navigate through the menus and song via a touch-wheel for scrolling and click-able buttons for selection.

42.sentence: One caveat I have is that I understand the iPod does not save the photos in such a way that the quality of the image is preserved.

60.sentence: No inbox accessories-- An arm strap, belt strap, case, or anything would be nice, but nope... Moveable parts-- This makes me almost want to keep my 3rd gen over a 4th; with moveable parts, its easy to damage an iPod at a gym, so this is for more casual listeners; note the iPod Mini doesn't have moveable parts and is made of titanium.

61.sentence: Comments: Overall this is still a great value, but is kind of overrated in the sense that there are beater deals on the market.

69.sentence: The iPod is a very nice product, which given reasonable care, should give a lot of service.

70.sentence: First, let me say that I got the 20gb iPod for Christmas, and I most likely would not have spent the $300 myself.

71.sentence: In addition, I do not think the battery lasts much more than eight to ten hours, and it can take four hours for a full charge.

72.sentence: I have about 6 gb used on my iPod so far (well over 1000 songs), and as far as I can tell, all of them play at near-cd quality.

73.sentence: Other than the fact that one can't delete a file directly from the iPod, the interface is excellent and mind-numbingly simple to use.

74.sentence: Other than the fact that one can't delete a file directly from the iPod, the interface is excellent and mind-numbingly simple to use.

75.sentence: As for iTunes, I don't find it to be as good as the Windows Media Player as a computer mp3 player, but it is good enough.

76.sentence: In conclusion, I gave the iPod a 4/5 because anything this expensive should would work just about flawlessly.

77.sentence: *The ipod is overly sensitive to just about everything and gets scratched easily.

79.sentence: You can't change the battery, so I don't know what I'm going to do in a year or so.

84.sentence: Everything I Wanted! The Apple iPod has become one of the most sought-after electronic gadgets - and for good reason.

85.sentence: Its sleek design, large memory capacity, compatibility with iTunes, and ease of use makes this one of the best portable digital listening devices on the market.

86.sentence: Its sleek design, large memory capacity, compatibility with iTunes, and ease of use makes this one of the best portable digital listening devices on the market.

88.sentence: Unless you have an enormous music/audio book library, the 20 GB model should have more than adequate storage capacity, with a stated ability to hold 5000 songs.

89.sentence: Features: click wheel to navigate; ability to work with Windows or Mac; optional backlighting (you can have it on all the time, or have it shut off to save battery power after 5, 10, or 20 seconds); ability to download PDA info; automatic or manual download from iTunes when iPod is plugged into your computer.

92.sentence: There's even an equalizer (under "settings") that allows you to adjust the sound for acoustic, bass booster, bass reducer, classical, dance, "deep", and electronic.

93.sentence: With accessories, you can make the iPod into a digital recorder, broadcast it remotely through stereo speakers using wireless technology, and play it through your car speakers using either a CD adaptor or FM stereo broadcaster.

94.sentence: The iPod comes formatted for the Mac, but within seconds of plugging it into a PC, is automatically reformatted for Windows.  (The HP version comes with Windows formatting, and takes seconds to change to Mac.) Although the iPod can be changed from one format to another, you will lose all of your music and data when doing so.

95.sentence: ITunes can be downloaded from the enclosed CD or for free from the Apple site.

96.sentence: Its steel backing picks up fingerprints and scratches easily, not great from a cosmetic standpoint.

97.sentence: All in all, this is a wonderful device.

98.sentence: The weight is heavier than many digital players, but I like the solid feel.

99.sentence: The weight is heavier than many digital players, but I like the solid feel.

100.sentence: Holy cow! It really does scratch easily!

101.sentence: The thing has survived plenty of falls with little or no damage, except the inevitable scratches.

111.sentence: The Great And Versatile iPod  I love my iPod!

112.sentence: The sound quality is excellent, accessing the music is easy, and the controls are generally well thought out.

113.sentence: The sound quality is excellent, accessing the music is easy, and the controls are generally well thought out.

114.sentence: As a Windows user, I had to install the software including drivers and iTunes on my desktop, and this is the only area where I encountered a nuisance.

115.sentence: I still give the iPod five stars, though, as it could have been something I did incorrectly during the install (though I did follow the onscreen prompts) so I'll give Apple the benefit of the doubt.

116.sentence: The battery holds a charge for a very long time (maybe 15 or so hours of use) so realistically there are no real range or endurance issues associated with iPod use.

117.sentence: My only complaint (really more of an observation) is that the outside finish of the iPod is rather delicate, so I am going to get a case for mine so it doesn't get all scratched up.

118.sentence: (It sure does look nice, though!)  I recommend this to any music lover anywhere: the quality of the audio is excellent, the controls and indicators rapidly become intuitive, and the storage capacity and battery life are huge!

121.sentence: Using the software iTunes is relatively simple, you just plug the USB cable in, wait your machine to detect the iPod and voila, any songs listed in your iTunes library will be transfered on over to the iPod.

122.sentence: And, with the iPods' full volume up, all you have to do is adjust your receivers' volume and your set, since the iPod itself acts as a strong amplifer of its' own.

123.sentence: If there were any complaints I have, they are marginal, but one is Apples' properietary set-up for music files, their incompatibility with other music services (i.e. Napster) is down right wrong.

124.sentence: However after purchasing a 20 GB iPod it's clear to see the superiority.

125.sentence: For a sleeker, smaller and more "average" MP3 player the Nitrus is great but the iPod blows it out of the water - the interface is great and the design is wonderful.

129.sentence: The actual experience of USING the iPod is magnificent.

130.sentence: The design, as mentioned above, is sleek, cool and trendy (and I think trendy = good, but it's always hard to tell these days).

131.sentence: The battery life lastes 12 hours, and charges quickly. (As mentioned above, the initial charge is a minimum of only two hours - not too long at all!) Once you've downloaded your music, you can access the tracks by artist, genre, album, composer (this comes in handy when the actual composer is different from the artist - e.g. covers of songs), etc.

133.sentence: The included earphones are pretty good - my advice?

134.sentence: The ease of use of the iPod is a major attribute.

135.sentence: With the iPod, you can also store documents and contact files (from programs such as Microsoft Outlook) when it's connected to your PC as an external hard drive.

136.sentence: Also included in the "games" section is the great music trivia option - which tests your skill at being able to quickly place your own songs.

137.sentence: 20 GB OR 40 GB?  The pros of the 40 GB: Comes with a "dock station" and double storage space (10,000 songs).
